title: A is twice as good a workman as B and together they finish a piece of work in 18 days. In how many days can A alone finish the work? - Quora
tags: State Bank of India Probationary Officer
Staff Selection Commission Combined Graduate Level Exam

response.answer_text: Let's say that B does x[p.o.w/day]x[p.o.w/day]and A does 2x2x[p.o.w/day],[p.o.w/day],where p.o.w stands for pieces of work. Now, we know that together they finish 1p.o.w1p.o.w in 18days.18days. Putting the information in an equation, we have (x+2x)p.o.wday×18days=1p.o.w(x+2x)p.o.wday×18days=1p.o.w x=154p.o.wdaysx=154p.o.wdays Now, we know that B does 1/54[p.o.w/day]1/54[p.o.w/day]and A does 2/54[p.o.w/day].2/54[p.o.w/day]. Finally to determine in how many days A alone will finish 1p.o.w1p.o.w we can use 254p.o.wday×ydays=1p.o.w254p.o.wday×ydays=1p.o.w y=27daysy=27days A will finish in 27 days one piece of work.

Together they complete the work in 18 days So, in one day they complete 1/18 work. Since A is twice good as B So A's workdone in one day= 2x & B's workdone in one day= x So, 2x + x = 1/18       3x        = 1/18         X =    1/54  So, B's workdone in oneday= 1/54 &     A's  workdone in one day= 1/27 So,  A alone will take 27 days to complete a piece of work Ans: 27 days

A is twice as good as B and together they finish a piece of work in 18 days. In how many days B alone will finish the job? A does 1/x amount of the work while B does 1/2x amount in the same time. Together they do 1/x + 1/2x = 3/2x amount in the same time. So the time taken to complete the job is 2x/3 = 18. So x = 3*18/2 = 27. So A would take 27 days and B 54 days to do the same job, working alone. Check: 1/x + 1/2x = 1/27 + 1/54 = 2/54 + 1/54 = 3/54. So time taken be both working together is 54/3 = 18 days. Correct. B requires 54 days.

Let B be x and A be 2x (A+B)'s 18 days' work=1 (A+B)'s 1 days' work=1/18 This can also be written as  x+2x=1/18 3x=1/18 x=1/54 Let's multiply both sides of this equation by 2.  Therefore,   2x=1/27=>A's 1 day's work=1/27 Thus, A alone can do a piece of work in 27 days. IF YOU LIKE THIS ANSWER, PLEASE UPVOTE IT. THANKS!!!

For solving this problem lets assume , A and B together have to manufacture 54 pens . now you think why we take 54 , its only for convenience we can assume anything We know that A efficiency is double than B , then it is clear that in 18 days A manufacture double pencil compare to B . That’s why A manufacture 36 pencil in 18 days whereas B manufacture only 18 pencil as their efficiency is half than A. Now, the condition is if A alone manufacture whole 54 pencil then how many days he have to work. It takes 18 days + 9 days [ for manufacture 18 pencil of B ] = 27

A is TWICE as gòod as B together the complete the work in 18 days.Person A, Therefore produces total output of 2/3 so 66.66% work content in 18 days, (2:1ratio)Person B, Therefore produces total output of 1/3 so 33.33% work content in 18 days. (1:2 ratio)Person A, so based on Prorata rates for achieving 100% = Answer is: 27 days. ( 2/3 = 18 days)Person B, so based on Prorata rates for achieving 100% = 54 days. ( 1/3 = 18 days)Just to confirm A is twice as good as B he completes the job in half the time or B takes twice the time to complete the job the job analysis is therefore correct; A 27 days compared to B 54 days = 2:1 ratio.

27 is the answer. You have to break down the joint 1/18 completion rate so that it reflects A as the one doing twice of what B is doing within that small fraction. Simply convert 1/18 into its equivalent 3/54, and use the ratio of 2/54 : 1/54 to illustrate that A is doing twice the work of B. Working alone, A can finish in 27 days, as you can see after you reduce 2/54 to 1/27. B will take twice as long, or 54 days.

Say B does x amount of work in a day. Hence, A would be able to do 2x in a day. Together they do 3x work in a day and if it takes 18 days to finish the entire work W, then W = 18 * 3x = 54x. If A alone works at the rate of 2x per day, to finish the entire Work W=54x, he would need 54x/2x = 27 days to finish the work. Hope it helped.

Since “A” is twice as good as “B” , then if A can finish a work in X - days, then B can finish it in 2X days.So 1/X+ 1/2X= 1/18;Upon solving we get 3/2x= 54So x= 27;So A alone can finish the work in 27- days.B alone can finish the work in = 2X = 2 x 27= 54 - days.

A has capacity to do work is double than B and their efficiency ratio is 2 is to 1. let A take x days to comlete the work then B takes 2x days. A+B one days work is =1/x+1/2x=1/18=>x=27 hence x=27 are the days to comlpete the work by A

If B does (1/3) of a work in some time t, A does ( 2/3) of work in the same time t. Together they complete 1/3 + 2/3 = 1 work in time t , i.e, in 18 days. B completes 1/3 of work in 18 days. To complete the full work , B needs 3* 18 = 54 days A completes 2/3 of a work in 18 days. To complete the full work he needs 18 + 9 = 27 days.

Let the work done by B be x and A be 2x. Hence both together does 3x work in one day. By doing 3x work in one day, they can finish the work in 18 days. Hence 3x*18=1. 54x=1 x=1/54 Hence B alone can finish the work in 54 days. As A is twice as good a workman as B, A alone can finish it in 54/2=27 days
Together they finish the work in 18 days means 3‘B’s(‘A’ = 2‘B’s) finish the work in 18 days. ‘B’ finishes the work in 18*3 days. ‘A’ (2 ‘B’s) finishes the work in 18*3/2 = 27 days.

Answer : Person A alone will complete the work in 27 Days As per given problem Person A does the work 2 times faster than Person B Persons A and B can together do the work in 18 Days, It means Persons A and B do (1/18) th portion of work in a single Day Let Person A alone can do the work in “ X” Days, It means Person A does (1/X) th portion of work in a single Day As per given problem Person B alone can do [(1/2 X )]th portion in a Day Hence, Persons A and B together can complete [ (1/X ) + ( 1/2 X )] th portion of the work in a Day which equals to (1/18) By equating these two we will get( 3/2 X ) = ( 1/ 18) or X = ( 54/2 ) = 27 Days Hence, Person A alone will complete the work in (54/2) = 27 Days and Person B alone will complete the work in 54 Days
A=2x and B=x A and B together 3x will take 18 days..B alone will take 18 *3 = 54 daysSince A is twice as fast as B so 54/2 = 27 days...

27 days. Since “A” does twice as much work as “B”, it would take “A” 9 days to do the work that it took “B”18 days to do, therefore “A”, working alone, could do the job in 27 days… 18 days to do his share of the job + 9 more days to do the share of the job that took “B” 18 days to do.

The efficiency ratio is 2:1 and the ratio of days is 1:2 Now, x/(1/1 +1/2) = 18 x = 18*3/2 = 27 days. Alternatively, if A takes x days B will take 2*x days. It implies: 1/x + 1/2*x = 1/18 Solving, we get x = 27 days.

A+B=1/18 →1 A is twice as B from this we conclude that A=2B →2 Sub eq 2 in 1 2B+B=1/18 3B=1/18 B=1/54 A+1/54=1/18 A=1/18–1/54 =>(3–1/54)=>(2/54)=>1/27 Therefore A alone can finish the work in 27 days and B can finish in 54 days
A does the job in A days, so every day he/she does 1 / A of the job. B does the job in 2A days, so every day he/she does 1 / 2A of the job. 1 / A + 1 / 2A = 1 / 18 3A / 2A = 1 / 18 A = 27

A is twice as good, so B=2A, or B takes twice as long as A . Also, 1/A + 1/B=1/18 since, together, they finish the work in 18 days. So: 1/A + 1/2A=1/18 18+9=A A=27 days working alone B=54 days alone ☺☺☺☺

A can finish (1/x) of a piece of work in 1 day. B can finish (1/2x) of a piece of work in 1 day. Together A and B can finish (1/x) + (1/2x) = (3/2x) = (1/18) of a piece of work in 1 day. 2x = 54 , x = 27. A alone can finish the work in 27 days.
A is twice do more work than B . It means - 2A=1B A/B=1/2 A+B=3 Total days taken by them are=18 days So the total work is =18*3 =54 A=54*1/3 =18 days.
If A does the work alone in x days , B will take 2x days Together in 1 day they do 1/x +1/2x = 1/18 18 + 9 = x x = 27 days ANSWER A = 27 days CHECK 1/27+1/54 = 3/54 = 1/18 = 18 days
Let B take x days to do a job Then A takes x/2 days Per day they work together 1/x+2/x(=3/x)of work In 18days they do 3/x•18 of work 54/x=1 X=54 A takes 54/2=27days
B=1/2 Therefore, A+1/2A =18 days A+A/2=18 3A/2=18 3A=36 therfore, A=12 A alone will finish the work in 12 days
(A+B)’s 1 day’s work=1/18 A’s 1 day’s work=(1/18*2/3)=1/27 A alone can finish a work in 27 days
